description: She recently revealed she almost died from an eating disorder. But it seems Kesha is ready to embrace a positive body image, if one of her latest Instagram posts is any indication.
title: Kesha flaunts her curves in tank top and underwear
title_page: Kesha flaunts her curves in tank top and underwear | Daily Mail Online
text:
She recently revealed she almost died from an eating disorder.
But Kesha is clearly ready to embrace a positive body image, if one of her latest Instagram posts is any indication.
The 30-year-old Tik Tok hitmaker certainly heated things up with her racy selfie, which she posted on Wednesday evening.
Eye-popping: Kesha, 30, certainly heated things up with her racy selfie, which she posted on Wednesday evening
In the snap, which appears to have been taken using a mirror, Kesha is leaning against a wall in her bedroom.
She wears only a nude-colored tank, which barely contains her sizeable cleavage, and a pair of very skimpy dark panties.
The bottom of the tank has even been knotted, to expose just a tad more skin.
Her blonde tresses are down, while it appears she is also sporting some very smokey eye make-up.
Hiding something? In the photo, the pop star appears in a Beavis and Butthead sweatshirt, which she has pulled up all the way past her nose
While the image was quite sizzling, her caption was slightly more mystifying, as it consisted of only two nail polish emojis.
Around the same time she also posted an image that was somewhat more conservative in terms of the visuals.
In the photo, the pop star appears in a Beavis and Butthead sweatshirt, which she has pulled up all the way past her nose.
She also appears to be giving a middle finger to the camera.
Warning: On Tuesday, the Blah Blah Blah singer said a lack of self-confidence can lead people into a spiral of negative feelings and that's just what happened to her
That caption was more direct: 'feelin good as hell.'
On Tuesday, the Blah Blah Blah singer said a lack of self-confidence can lead people into a spiral of negative feelings and that's just what happened to her.
'If you feel a certain way about yourself, your body - it can kill you. I almost died. I came closer than I ever knew,' she revealed during Refinery 29's Reclaiming the Internet SXSW panel in Austin, Texas.
She continued: 'By the time I entered rehab, they were surprised I hadn't had a stroke - because I hadn't consumed enough. I'm not ashamed anymore. It's emotional because it's a deep-rooted disease. It can really affect your self-worth.'
